summary: In this context, Hexan-2-one is mentioned as part of a formulation combined with benzaldehyde aimed at protecting dogs from infestation by the brown dog tick, R. sanguineus s. l. The study suggests that this formulation could enhance the effectiveness of anti-tick vaccines, thereby reducing tick infestations and the transmission of tick-borne diseases. The relationship is significant as it highlights the potential role of Hexan-2-one in pest management strategies.
